contentrichtext.text: '''Yelena Borisovna Yelesina''' ({{lang-ru|Елена Борисовна Елесина}}; born April 4, 1970 in [[Chelyabinsk]]) is a female [[high jump]]er from [[Russia]]. She won the gold medal at the [[Athletics at the 2000 Summer Olympics|2000 Summer Olympics]] with 2,01m, one centimetre behind her personal best jump. She also has several minor medals from major championships. ==Achievements== {| {{AchievementTable|Event=yes}} |- !colspan="6"|Representing {{URS}} |- |1988 |[[1988 World Junior Championships in Athletics|World Junior Championships]] |[[Greater Sudbury|Sudbury]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]] |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |High jump | |- |1990 |[[Goodwill Games]] |[[Seattle]], [[United States|U.S.]] |[[1992 European Indoor Championships in Athletics|European Indoor Championships]] |[[Genoa]], [[Italy]] |bgcolor=CC9966 align="center" | 3rd |High jump | |- !colspan="6"|Representing {{RUS}} |- |1998
